trans-unit.source: Binds the value of a client-side HTTP cookie to a parameter object.
The parameter can be used in a parameterized query or command to select, filter, or update data.

You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter> class to bind the value of a client-side HTTP cookie passed as part of an HTTP request to a parameter used by ASP.NET data source controls.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter> class provides the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter.CookieName%2A> property, which identifies the name of the <xref:System.Web.HttpCookie> object to bind to, in addition to those inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter> class attempts to bind to the named cookie every time the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter.Evaluate%2A> method is called.

Controls that bind data to the parameter might throw an exception if a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter> object is specified, but no corresponding cookie is passed with the HTTP request.
Similarly, they might display no data if the cookie is passed with `null`.
Set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property to avoid these situations where appropriate.
Initializes a new unnamed instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter"></xref> class.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter> object created with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter.%23ctor%2A> constructor is initialized with default values for all its properties.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter.CookieName%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>.

Additionally, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.TypeCode?displayProperty=fullName>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection.Input>, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property is initialized to `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the class with the values of the instance specified by the original parameter.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter.%23ctor%2A> constructor is a `protected` copy constructor used to clone a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter> instance.

The property values of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter> object, including <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter.CookieName%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A>, are all transferred to the new instance.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter"></xref> from which the current instance is initialized.
Initializes a new named instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter"></xref> class, using the specified string to identify which HTTP cookie to bind to.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter> object created with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter.%23ctor%2A> constructor is initialized with the specified parameter name and string that identifies the cookie that the parameter binds to.
Other properties, including <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A>, are initialized with default values.
The name of the parameter.
The name of the HTTP cookie that the parameter object is bound to.
The default is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter"></xref> class that has the specified name and database type and that is bound to the specified HTTP cookie.
The name of the parameter.
The database type that the parameter represents.
The name of the HTTP cookie that the parameter object is bound to.
The default is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Initializes a new named and strongly typed instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter"></xref> class, using the specified string to identify which HTTP cookie to bind to.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter> object created with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter.%23ctor%2A> constructor is initialized with the specified parameter name, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A>, and string that identifies the cookie that the parameter binds to.
Only the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.ConvertEmptyStringToNull%2A> properties are initialized with default values.
The name of the parameter.
The type that the parameter represents.
The default is <xref href="System.TypeCode.Object"></xref>.
The name of the HTTP cookie that the parameter object is bound to.
The default is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Returns a duplicate of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter"></xref> instance.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter.Clone%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter.%23ctor%2A> copy constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter> class with the values of the current instance.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter"></xref> that is an exact duplicate of the current one.
Gets or sets the name of the HTTP cookie that the parameter binds to.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter.CookieName%2A> property identifies an HTTP cookie, which is represented by an <xref:System.Web.HttpCookie> object and is available through the current <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest> object.

If the HTTP cookie is not available in the current <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest> object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter.Evaluate%2A> method binds the parameter to the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property, if it is set.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property is not set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter.Evaluate%2A> method fails to bind the parameter to a value.
A string that identifies the client-side HTTP cookie that the parameter binds to.
Updates and returns the value of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter"></xref> object.

The `context` parameter is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter.Evaluate%2A> method to retrieve the cookies collection and the value of the cookie that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter> object binds to.
The `control` parameter is ignored.
The current <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> of the request.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> that is associated with the Web Forms page where the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter"></xref> is used.
An object that represents the updated and current value of the parameter.
If the context or the request is `null`, the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CookieParameter.Evaluate(System.Web.HttpContext,System.Web.UI.Control)"></xref> method returns null.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the parameter's value is validated.
`true` if the parameter's value is validated; otherwise, `false`.
